Fig. D-14   Find Market Partner


                         You can search for market partners on this dialog. You enter the search criteria
                         in the header area. If you open Find Market Partners, you will see all market
                         partners in the hit list that are stored in the master data and not yet disabled.
                         With internal site separation, only the market partners are listed that are as-
                         signed to the site. Using the filter criteria, you can restrict the hit list.
                         You can configure in which search criterion field you are first located for input
                         when you open the dialog. Configurable as initial input fields are the fields
                         From No., Matchcode, Name, 1stName, Cntry, PCd, and Town.
                         You can call up the market partner search via various menu paths. The dialog
                         always looks the same.
                         •   Use <F3> to start the search.
                         •   Use <F2> after the search to change tabs on the hit list.
                         •   Use the arrow keys and <Page Up>, <Page Down> to navigate the hit list.
                         The hit list displays the addresses and information for identification of the mar-
                         ket partners:
                         •   “Address tab” on page D-1089
                         •   “Identification tab” on page D-1090

                             Default setting for the market partner types
                             Depending on which menu path you use to open the dialog, the market
                             partner type you're looking for can be set already, e.g. customer or supplier.
                             The hit list is then filtered accordingly. The selection of the market partner
                             types is only possible when searching in the master data.


A+W Enterprise Sales                                                                              D-1087
Search Functions                                                             Software Reference




                   Search fields

                   From No. Start number from which market partners are searched for in as-
                   cending order. The market partners whose number is smaller than the number
                   specified are excluded from the hit list.
                   Technical info: numeric field, DB field: mp.mpnr

                   Matchcode Alphanumeric matchcode of the market partner. The market part-
                   ners whose match code does not include the data specified are excluded from
                   the hit list.
                   Technical info: alphanumeric field, DB field: mp.mc

                   Type Display of the market partner type. The type is stored in the market part-
                   ner master data. The field is automatically pre-populated by the system.
                   Technical info: display field, DB field: mp.kuliflag

                   Name, 1stName Name and first name of the market partner. The market
                   partners whose names do not include the data specified are excluded from the
                   hit list.
                   Technical info: alphanumeric fields, DB fields: mp.name, mp.vaname

                   Street Street address of the market partner. The market partners whose
                   street address does not include the data specified are excluded from the hit
                   list.
                   Technical info: alphanumeric field, DB field: mp.strasse

                   Site Site number with internal site separation. The market partners that are
                   not assigned to the specified site are excluded from the hit list.
                   Technical info: numeric field, DB field: mpmdzu.hnr

                   Country International country code of the market partner. The market part-

                       Show record for the market partner overview
                       The number of hits in the list is indicated on the right, above the tabs, in a
                       frame. The display means Item overview: No. of the currently marked hits in
                       the list: Total number of hits in the list.

                           The display of hits is loaded record by record
                           If a large number of hits has to be displayed, under some circumstances, it
                           can take some time for the system to do this. So that the hit list can be dis-
                           played quickly, it is loaded record by record. The record size is configured
                           in the system settings. The hits are loaded in numeric sequence, e.g. the
                           first 100 hits numerically. Additional hits can be loaded with the [More Data]
                           button.

                       Explanation of symbols
                       This section describes the identifiers for the dialog mode, the item status, and
                       the item identifier.

                       Dialog mode
                       The dialog mode is shown in the title line of the dialog.

                       Symbol Symbol description         Meaning

                                  Dialog with cross      In this mode you can create new records.

                                  Dialog with pen        In this mode, you can edit a data record.

                                  Yellow triangle with   In this mode, you cannot edit a data record, e.g.
                                  exclamation point      because it has already been transmitted to
                                                         production.

                                  Search                 In this mode, you can search for data records.

                       Tab. D-1         Dialog mode

                       Item status and item identifier
                       The item status is displayed on the Items tab next to the Item field.

                       Symbol Symbol description         Meaning

                                  green                  The item can be edited at will since production
                                                         has not begun yet.

                                  yellow                 The item or sub-parts of the item have been
                                                         ordered or the purchase order has been printed.

                                  red                    Item has been planned in production. It can no
                                                         longer be edited.

                                  three quarters red,    Item has been partially delivered.
                                  one quarter blue

                                  half red, half blue    Item has been fully delivered.

                                  two quarters red,      Item has been partially invoiced.
                                  two quarters blue

                                  blue                   Item has been invoiced completely.

                                  Red cross              The item will be deleted.

                       Tab. D-2         Item status

                       The item identifier is displayed in front of the Item field.

                              unit.

                      Order types
                      Sales > Order Entry > Entry Date field, Invoice type, Project > <Ctrl> + <F12>




                      Fig. D-65     Order types


                      Select an order type on this dialog. By default, the normal order is selected as
                      order type. If you select another order type, it is displayed as dialog name in
                      the header of the dialog.
                      •   Normal Order
                          Preset default in order entry.
                      •   Site-internal order:
                          Internal order in own site. The order will not be transferred to dispatch con-
                          trol and cannot be invoiced. It is used for internal order processing between
                          your own and another site. The order can be completed in-house. In the
                          destination site, the order is entered as normal order.
                      •   Group-internal order:
                          Internal order processing between two sites. The order is calculated in the
                          destination site as normal order.
                      •   On call order:
                          On-call order. Is no longer used. For the reservation of capacities in A+W
                          Production, the Reservation order order type must be selected.
                      •   Stock order:
                          Production order for the internal stock, without invoice. A stock order is en-
                          tered if the stock is low. After completion reporting from A+W Production,
                          the goods receipt must be booked. Depending on the configuration, stock
                          orders are generated automatically by the system.
                      •   Complaint order:
                          Complaint order. A complaint order is entered if the invoice amount is equal
                          to zero and the item amount is not equal to zero. At the end of the entry, a
                          dialog for specification of the complaint reason opens.
                           “Complaint” on page D-1211
                      •   Reservation order:
                          Order that reserves the capacities in A+W Production, e.g. if the precise di-
                          mensions for the order items are missing.Reservation orders can be
                          scheduled with the familiar order data. They are not transferred to dispatch
                          control. If there is precise order data from a customer, it is entered into the
                          existing order, the order type changed to Normal order, and the order is re-
                          leased again.




D-1212                                                                          A+W Enterprise Sales
Software Reference                                                             Document Management




                       •   Calculation type:The calculation type is used to determine the sales price
                           based on the production costs. For this order type, the cost calculation
                           must be enabled. The calculation type is only configured customer-specif-
                           ically.
                       •   Top priority order:Order that is scheduled with higher priority in A+W Pro-
                           duction. The order can be edited with normal or the highest priority in the
                           scheduling editor. Orders with the highest priority are scheduled with mini-
                           mum transfer times. They are also scheduled by the system if there is no
                           more production capacity available. You can only enter and edit top priority
                           orders with the appropriate rights.
                       •   Replacement order:Customer-specific order, e.g. for replacement or fulfill-
                           ing warranty obligations. The replacement order is calculated and sched-
                           uled like a normal order. The customer support representative decides
                           whether the order is delivered for free. For statistical evaluations, informa-
                           tion about the replacement order, e.g. the reference to the original order, is
                           saved.
                       •   Dispatch order:
                           Order that is not transferred to production, but rather directly to dispatch
                           control. The system has to be configured appropriately.
                       •   Reference price list:Quotation overview in order to display a customer-spe-
                           cific price list. The customer can view the price list on an INternet portal.
                           You can only enter a reference price list with the appropriate rights and if
                           the iska filter interface is enabled.
                       •   Takeback order:Customer-specific order for editing credits, for example.
                           For takeback orders, the current date is always pre-defined as requested
                           date and the order total is equal to zero. Takeback orders are not trans-
                           ferred to production after release, but rather only to dispatch. You can only
                           enter, edit, and/or release a takeback order with the appropriate rights.

                          Use this dialog to import data from an external spreadsheet program into A+W

                          data is in the columns is something that you specify in the header rpw of the
                          table. You can choose among ten different header fields. You have to select at
                          least the four mandatory fields Article, Qty, Width, and Height in the header
                          row if you want to start the data import. If you have not selected the fields, a
                          message with an appropriate note is displayed.
                          To import the data, you have to mark the appropriate rows and columns with
                          the data in the spreadsheet program and copy them to the clipboard.
                          Use [Import] to insert the data on the External Data - Import dialog in A+W En-
                          terprise. If you have imported the data, a query is displayed asking whether
                          you want to retain the existing column assignment. With [Yes] it is checked
                          whether the data imported and the format specifications for the associated
                          fields in the header area match. With [No] you can edit the fields in the first row.
                          Use <End> to complete the editing and the imported data is checked.
                          If the data fulfills the specifications of the field in question, a selected checkbox
                          is displayed next to the item. If the data is flawed, a red cross appears. You
                          can only take over items into the document if the data format of all fields fulfills
                          the specifications in the item row.

                       Shape - dimensions
                       The dimension details differ depending on the selected model. Therefore, no
                       precise description of the reference of the fields to the database is possible.
                       The shape parameters are saved in the database fields kpodparam.param1 to
                       kpodparam.param10. For free shapes, the value is saved in the database un-
                       der the entry kmpdparam.param99. For free shapes, the shape description is
                       also saved in the database field kmpdparam.param99.

                       H, H(n) Height of the lite. Depending on the shape, there are different speci-
                       fications for the lite sides. The letter H means the total height and the letter
                       H(n) means the partial height of H. If there are several height specifications,
                       these are numbered consecutively.

                       W, W(n) Width of the lite. Depending on the shape, there are different speci-
                       fications for the lite sides. The letter W means the total width and the letter
                       W(n) means the partial height of W. If there are several width specifications,
                       these are numbered consecutively.

                       R, R(n) Radius of the lite. The radius is only used as dimension for circular
                       shaped lites or arcs. For shapes with several circles or arcs, the various radii
                       are specified as R(n). If there are several radius specifications, these are num-
                       bered consecutively.

                       D Diameter of the lite. The diameter is only used as a dimension for circular
                       shaped sheets.

                       S Segment height (Sagitta) of the lite. S stands for the height of the segment,
                       that is, the distance between the middle of the circle and chord. The segment
                       height is only used as dimensions for shaped sheets with circular segments.

                       (Text field without name) Text field for additional information.

                       Product structure
                       The product structure considers the installation positions of the lites. The sun
                       symbolizes the outside and indicates the sequence of the product structure
                       from outside to inside.
                       There are always two installation positions (IP) specified for glass. The first
                       glass occupies the installation positions 1 and 2, the second glass the instal-
                       lation positions 3 and 4, etc.
                       The reason for this is as follows: during assembly of a multi-lite window, the
                       orientation of the individual components can be specified clearly by the instal-
                       lation position. The installation position defines the sequence and orientation
                       of the individual components, e.g. the lites, foils, airspaces, processings, and
                       frame parts.
                       For processings, e.g. drillings or cuts, the orientation is also important. Coated
                       or structured lites can only be processed on the side without coating or struc-
                       ture. With the installation position, the characteristics of the lite are considered
                       for the order. This way, the processing, e.g. cutting of structured lites, can be
                       scheduled in the workflow.

                       •  1 = order before EDI:

                          The subpart is produced internally before the head part is transferred to the
                          corresponding producing site. The supplier is notified that the subpart is in-
                          cluded in the delivery.
                       • 4 = P.O.:

                       • 5 = stock withdrawal:
                          Subpart is withdrawn from the stock.
                       • 6 = production:

                       • 7 = incl. in delivery:
                          Subpart will be included in the delivery to the supplier by the customer.
                       • 8 = not available:
                          The subpart is not available.
                       • 9 = included in delivery before EDI:
                          The supply type is evaluated before the subpart is ordered via EDI from a
                          different site and is included in their delivery.

                     Packaging Planning
                     You can use packaging planning to plan which and how many forms of pack-
                     aging you need for the order. The system creates the planning automatically
                     according to your specifications.
                     Generally lites are packed on racks. Therefore, the terms packaging form and
                     rack are used synonymously for the field and column designations on the dia-
                     logs.
                     You can select different sorting algorithms that specify the item quantities on
                     the racks. In addition you can, depending on the sorting algorithm selected,
                     make your own specifications for the racks, e.g. the number of lites that should
                     be loaded on the rack.
                     Rack planning depends on the particular system configuration and the settings
                     in the master data.
                     For customer-specific adjustments, contact your contact person at A+W Soft-
                     ware GmbH.
                     This section describes the following dialogs:
                     •   “Specs. packaging planning” on page D-1292
                     •   “Packaging planning” on page D-1298

                     Overview of specifications for packaging planning
                     •   Itm:
                         Item number.
                         Technical info: display field, DB field: kposgest.posnr
                     •   Qty:
                         Quantity of the item.Technical info: display field, DB field: kpos.menge
                     •   Sort:
                         Sorting algorithm. If you chage the sorting algorithm for an item, then you
                         are asked if you would like to specify it for all items. If you confirm the query,
                         the sorting algorithm is taken over for all items. You can also combine the
                         sorting algorithms.
                         – TA:
                            Total algorithm.You have to specify the rack type or the rack main group.
                            The item quantities are distributed automatically by the system on the
                            rack. You cannot specify the number of lites on the rack and the group-
                            ing. With the selection of the total algorithm for an item, it is automati-
                            cally specified for all other items. If you want to combine the total
                            algorithm with other sorting algorithms, then you must first specify the
                            total algorithm and then the other sorting algorithms for individual items.
                            The total algorithm is selected by default.
                         – PA:
                            Partial algorithm.
                            You have to specify the rack type or the rack main group. You can also
                            specify the number of lites and the grouping.
                         – M:
                            Manual sorting.
                            You have to specify the rack type, number of lites, and the grouping. You
                            can also specify the rack main group.
                         – PA:
                            Priority-controlled algorithm. The item quantities are distributed auto-
                            matically by the system across the rack type with the highest priority. If
                            the item articles cannot be distributed across the rack type with the high-
                            est priority because restrictions are violated, then the next rack type in
                            the priority list is used. You can only select the priority-controlled algo-
                            rithm if a priority list for rack types was stored in the rack management.
                         – PO:
                            Rack planning with the Packaging Optimization (PMO) via a customer-
                            specific interface.
                         – PV:
                            Rack planning with the Packaging Optimization. The racks are planned
                            via a customer-specific interface with the Packaging Optimization
                            (PMO) and a 3D packing view of the rack loading can be displayed with
                            the Pack View.


D-1296                                                                           A+W Enterprise Sales
Software Reference                                                                   Packaging Planning




                           – EA:
                              Even algorithm.
                              You have to specify the rack type or the rack main group. For the num-
                              ber of lites, you can only specify an even number. The quantities in all
                              items also have to be even numbers. The group is specified by the sys-
                              tem automatically. If you specify the even algorithm for an item, then it
                              is automatically specified for all other items. If you want to combine the
                              even algorithm with other sorting algorithms, then you must first specify
                              the even algorithm and then the other sorting algorithms for individual
                              items.

         Notes
         Notes are internal information that is not output on forms. Depending on the
         configuration, they may be displayed automatically or they can be called up
         manually.
         You can enter several lines of text in a note. For each text line, you can set an
         individual priority and an info location.
         The market partner, article, and object notes can be stored in the master data.
         The document notes are only stored in the respective document and not in the
         master data.

             Database reference in the note texts
             The notes are stored in the database table memo. The type of note is spec-
             ified by the corresponding entries memp.typ, memo.key1-3 and
             memp.flag1-3.

         Priority              Meaning

         Low                   Notes can be viewed for the respective notes type via the Info
                               menu, but they are not displayed automatically.

         Medium                Notes can be viewed for the respective notes type via the Info
                               menu, but they are not displayed automatically.

         High                  Notes for the note type in question are displayed automatically
                               if the market partner, the document, the object or the article for
                               which the note was entered is called up.
                               If the note is displayed, the complete note text is displayed,
                               that is, even all text lines with the priority Low or Medium are
                               displayed.

         Block for reference   No reference can be made to documents with notes of this
                               priority. The stored information text is displayed automatically
                               if the document should be used as reference document or the
                               document is opened. This priority can only be selected for
                               document notes.

         Tab. D-8      Priority levels

         Depending on the note type, the note text is displayed automatically for the
         corresponding processing step if its priority is set to high:
         •   Document notes:
             These note texts are displayed as soon as the document is opened.
         •   Market partner notes:
             These note texts are displayed as soon as the market partner is selected.
             The note refers to the selected market partner, e.g. to the customer or sup-
             plier.
         •   Project note:
             These note texts are displayed as soon as the project is selected. You can
             only store notes for a project if you have selected a project for the order.
         •   Article notes:
             These note texts are displayed as soon as the article is selected.

                       Fig. D-124   Step prices


                       Enter scaled prices for stepped articles on this dialog, e.g. for IG articles.
                       • SA/PU
                          These entries are intended for Purchasing or Sales.
                       • from step width (mm):
                          Value of the step width in millimeters, e.g. €3.50 from a step width of
                          100 mm and €7.80 from a step width of 200 mm.
                       • Pieces:

                       • Surch.:
                          Value of the step surcharge in currency units, e.g. in euros.
                       • Surch. type:
                          Calculation type of the scaled surcharge for steps.
                          – CU/m2 = Price (currency unit) for scaling the step width is multiplied by
                             the number of steps and the value of the Surcharge field. This value is
                             added to the glass price.
                          – CU/piece/m2 net:
                             Scaling of the step width is multiplied by the number of steps and the
                             value of the Surcharge field. The result is multiplied by the area of the
                             surrounded rectangle of the article and added to the unit price.

                        Conditions for PCD processing
                        Sales > Order Entry > Items tab > Price field > <Shift> + <F9>
                        These dialogs display the price conditions of an item article.
                        The dialogs are divided into two tabs or areas, which display the price condi-
                        tions for sales and purchasing. The Purchasing tab is only enabled if the sup-
                        ply type PO or Included is selected for the item. The structure of the tabs and
                        areas differs depending on which price method is assigned to the item article.
                        The values are displayed that are relevant for the price calculation.
                        The individual price methods are described in detail in the Prices and Condi-
                        tions section:
                         Prices and Conditions, “Pricing methods” on page C-559
                        You can edit the values for the price conditions. If you would like to recalculate
                        the price, close the dialog. A query is displayed asking whether you would like
                        to recalculate the price. If you confirm the query, the prices will be calculated
                        with the document-related item conditions.
                        The following dialogs are described in this section:
                        •   “Conditions for PCD, PCD BASIC GLASS processing” on page D-1339
                        •   “Conditions for PCD BASIC GLASS” on page D-1343
                        •   “Conditions IG” on page D-1345
                        •   “Conditions IG (SWITZERLAND)” on page D-1350
                        •   “Conditions for PCD COLORED ARTICLE” on page D-1354
                        •   “Conditions for PCD PRICES GENERAL” on page D-1356
                        •   “Conditions for PCD GLASS DOORS” on page D-1358
                        •   “Conditions for manual prices” on page D-1361
                        •   “LAMI exchange/additional prices” on page D-1363
                        Depending on which price-relevant processings are included in the item's
                        BOM, the Processing Prices (SA), (PU) and Muntin Prices tabs are enabled.
                        The price properties for processing prices are specified in the master data.
                         Master Data, “Price characteristics” on page B-444
                        The Processing Prices (SA), (PU) and Muntin Prices tabs will be described
                        separately.
                        The following tabs are also described in this section:
                        •   “Item conditions – processing prices” on page D-1365

                             Depending on the system configuration, orders are not released during entry,
                             e.g. if the operator does not have sufficient rights, the contribution margin is
                             underrun or the company limit is exceeded. These orders have to be released
                             manually for further processing in order to transfer them later to the system;
                             that is, to production, purchasing, dispatch, and the warehouse.
                             The following dialogs are described in this section:

                             •   “Authorization” on page D-1382

                             On these dialogs, you search for and release an order for further processing.

                             lease.

          On the Order Release search dialog, you can filter the search for release:
          •   Enter search criteria > [Start]:
              You can select department or operator and/or reason in the specified com-
              pany. All orders are displayed that fulfill the criteria. If you don't enter any
              criteria, all orders not yet released are displayed in the hit list.
          •   [Individual] > Enter reason > Specify company, operator > [OK]:
              First you have to enter a reason and then you can select the company and/
              or the operator on the Release dialog.
          On the order release dialog, all orders are displayed that fulfill the search cri-
          teria.
          •   Use <Shift>+<F5> to open the marked order in the order entry.
          •   Use <Ctrl>+<F9> to release all orders.
          •   Use <Shift>+<F9> to release all orders starting with the marked order.
          •   Use <Shift>+<F12> to open the Blockage reasons for unsuccessful re-
              lease dialog. This dialog displays the reasons for the block of the order. The
              dialog is only displayed if an order is blocked for more than one reason.
          •   Use <F3> to release the selected orders.

           Delivery
           By default, delivery notes are entered and managed in the Shipping Control
           module because the bookings of packed and finished products from other
           modules and programs are forwarded automatically to the dispatch control. If
           the Shipping Control module is not configured, you can create delivery notes
           in the Sales module.
           Depending on the configuration, you can create a delivery plan for an order. In
           the delivery plan, you can break up the order into partial deliveries. A delivery
           note is created for each (partial) delivery of an order. The delivery note serves
           as proof of the order processing for logistics and transportation and for the
           customer's information. Depending on the type of deliveries, the system dis-
           tinguishes between complete and partial delivery notes. You can create and
           edit delivery notes automatically or manually.
           The functions depend on the settings in the master data and the respective
           system configuration.
           For customer-specific adjustments, contact your contact person at A+W Soft-
           ware GmbH.
           The following dialogs are described in this section:
           •   “Delivery plan” on page D-1385
           •   “Delivery information – delivery details” on page D-1387
           •   “Delivery notes (automatic)” on page D-1391
           •   “Delivery notes (manual)” on page D-1393
           •   “Delivery notes log” on page D-1395

                    Condition     Meaning

                    =             Search exactly for this value (e.g. market partner field = 600004 lists
                                  only documents relating to this market partner).

                    >             Search for larger values (e.g. market partner field > 600004 lists only
                                  documents with market partner numbers larger than 600004).

                    p             Search for patterns in text fields (e.g. field
                                   Shape 12 lists all documents with the reference text Shape 12.)

                    0             Search for values = 0 (e.g. market partner field 0 lists only market
                                  partners with the number 0).

                    z             Search all values in the range.

                    !             Search all values except for this value (e.g. Department field! 10 lists
                                  all departments except for the department with the number 10).

                    <             Search for smaller values (e.g. market partner field < 600004 lists
                                  only documents with market partner numbers smaller than 600004).

                       Use this dialog to enter processing remarks for a resubmission. When the re-
                       submission date has arrived, a message will be displayed for the selected em-
                       ployee at the program start or a reminder e-mail sent.
                       You can create process-free resubmissions without any reference to a docu-
                       ment.
                       You can only create document-related resubmissions if you enter a quotation
                       with a delivery date. These resubmissions are always related to a business
                       process.
                       •   Use <F6> to create additional resubmissions.
                       •   Use <F7> to delete individual resubmissions.
                       •   Use <End> to save the resubmission and close the dialog.

Information about the Help Cards
The depictions in the Help Cards are based on the delivery version A+W Enterprise V 6. Individual steps
in the workflows may deviate depending on the configuration.

   Orders as example
   Various functionalities can be started in several document types. In these help cards, they will always
   be shown using the example of an order.

   Keys and key combinations
   Knowledge of the operation is assumed as a precondition. In the steps, just one of the possible keys
   or key combinations will be named with which a function or menu can be called up. The functions and
   keys possible on the open dialog can be displayed in the prompt line at the lower edge of the dialog.

                       Overview
                       In the Purchasing module, you manage the documents that are required for
                       the successful processing of the purchasing business, such as purchase or-
                       ders, inquiries, receipt of goods, and invoices.
                       In the Purchasing part, you will find the following topics:
                       •    “Search Functions” on page E-1552
                       •    “Document Management” on page E-1580
                       •    “Purchase Order Pool” on page E-1566
                       •    “Texts” on page E-1629
                       •    “Receipt of Goods” on page E-1637
                       •    “Invoices and Credit Notes” on page E-1664
                       •    “Overviews” on page E-1680


                       The purchasing menu
                       Some of the available menu entries branch out to submenus. If these include
                       more than three entries, they are listed separately according to the following
                       overview.
                       The displayed entries depend on the respective configuration.
                       •    PO pool configuration
                       •    Configuration Order-Oriented PO Printing - this configuration is not used.
                            That's why it will not be described here.
                       •    Individual purchasing documents configuration
                      For customer-specific adjustments, contact your contact person at A+W Soft-
                      ware GmbH.

                   Search Functions
                   In the Purchase module, you can search via various categories for documents,
                   market partners, addresses, articles, and projects.
                   The search dialogs are structured the same way for all document types in Pur-
                   chasing. Operation of the search dialogs has been developed analog to pur-
                   chasing. In these instructions, the search functions are described using the
                   example of POs. Deviations from other dialogs and from Sales are mentioned
                   explicitly.
                   The following dialogs are described in this section:
                   •   “Find purchase orders” on page E-1552
                   •   “Find purchase orders – hit list” on page E-1558
                   Additional search dialogs are the same in Purchasing and Sales. They are de-
                   scribed in detail in the Sales section:

                    Sales, “Find market partner” on page D-1087
                    Sales, “Find addresses” on page D-1095
                    Sales, “Find article” on page D-1097
                    Sales, “Find article by types” on page D-1107
                    Sales, “Find product by element” on page D-1108

                   •   “Find purchase orders – document key” on page E-1553

                      Purchase Order Pool
                      In the PO pool, the following PO proposals are collected, which are combined
                      into one or several PO/s:
                      •   Order-related PO proposals from Sales.
                      •   PO proposals from stock, e.g. before stock inventory runs too low. This
                          function must be configured.
                          If no automatic PO proposals can be generated by the stock, you can cre-
                          ate the stock POs via the Purchase Order Entry dialog.
                      Depending on system configuration and specified supplier master data, POs
                      can be grouped 1:1 from the order data by the background process or first
                      grouped manually in the PO pool, then generated.
                      The PO release is done either automatically or when the PO is printed. The
                      following are the possibilities:
                      •   The purchase order is created and automatically released.
                      •   The purchase order is printed and automatically released.
                      •   The purchase order is manually released using the Purchase order release
                          dialog.
                      Depending on the system configuration, the PO release is possible via the
                      Purchase Order Release menu element:
                       “Purchase Order Release” on page E-1631
                      Another possibility exists if the system is configured accordingly when storing
                      a payment advice note. Insofar as the PO advice note is saved, the order is
                      set to the status Ordered.
                       “Dispatch notifications” on page E-1637
                      Use the Printing of forms or Email dialog to print purchase orders and send
                      them to the supplier. The dialogs are described in detail in the Sales section:
                       Sales, “Form printing” on page D-1419
                       Sales, “E-mail” on page D-1423
                      In the change log, you can check the status of a PO. The dialog is described
                      in detail for the Sales section:
                       Sales, “Amendment log” on page D-1228
                      The following information is available on this chapter:
                      •   “Special menus for the PO pool” on page E-1567
                      •   “Purchase Order Release” on page E-1631
                      •   “Creating purchase orders” on page E-1569

                       Additional purchase orders Purchase order number. You can use <F9> to

                       Create purchase order
                       To create the POs, the following steps must be taken:
                       •    In the Cr. field, select the PO proposals for which you want to create a PO.
                            Depending on the system configuration, with selection of a PO item from
                            the order, all other PO items from the same order are marked. The Keep
                            order items together option can also be used for selection deletion. If an ex-
                            tended workbench PO is to be created from the PO pool, all related com-
                            ponents for an order item and the date are marked on the block and thus
                            kept together.
                      •     With <Ctrl>+<F8> you group the PO proposals and create POs. If you se-
                            lect several items, one or several POs can be created for the items. The
                            grouping is done either according to selection, supplier change or orders.
                            The type of grouping can be specified via the system configuration.
                      •     Use <End> to trigger the PO creation and save the settings made. The POs
                            can be corrected on the PO Management dialog and released on the PO
                            Release dialog.

                       Delete grouping
                       You can reset the grouped item with already-assigned PO numbers in order to
                       leave the item in the PO pool. For this, select the item in question and remove
                       it from an order-related PO proposal by selecting the order item and deleting
                       the PO number for this PO item via <F4> > Reset selected items.

                      Document Management
                      The documents that you edit in the Purchasing area include supplier inquiries,
                      POs, receipts of goods, supplier invoices, and credit notes. The dialogs look
                      and work largely the same way as those for the Sales area.
                      The following sections are part of the document management:
                      •   “Explanation of symbols” on page E-1580
                      •   “Supplier inquiries” on page E-1583
                      •   “Purchase order entry” on page E-1584
                      •   “Purchase order items” on page E-1603
                      •   “Pick-up address” on page E-1625
                      •   “P.O. type” on page E-1627
                      •   “Allocation of document types” on page E-1628


                      Explanation of symbols
                      This section describes the identifiers for the dialog mode, the item status, and
                      the item identifier.

                      Dialog mode
                      The dialog mode is shown in the title line of the dialog.

                      Symbol     Symbol description     Meaning

                                 Dialog with cross      In this mode, you can create new records.


                                 Dialog with pen        In this mode, you can edit a document.


                                 Yellow triangle with   In this mode, you can not edit the document.
                                 exclamation point

                                 Find                   In this mode, you can search for documents.


                      Tab. E-1      Dialog mode

                      Item status and symbols
                      The item status is displayed on the Items tab next to the Item column.

                      Symbol     Symbol description     Meaning

                                 green                  The item can be changed as desired since the
                                                        purchase order has not yet been released.

                                 yellow                 The item or sub-parts of the item have been
                                                        ordered or the purchase order has been
                                                        printed.

                      Tab. E-2      Item status

                       enter into the system. The system checks the invoice data by comparing the
                       total net amount of the POs and the total net amount. The result of the invoice
                       checking is displayed in a message:
                       • "Total amount is correct.“:
                           The total of the invoice amounts from the Net amount matches the Total net
                           amount. The internal invoice is created with [Yes]. In another message, you
                           can book the invoice.
                       • "The total amount is not correct.“:
                           The total of the invoice amounts from the Net amount column does not
                           match the Total amount. The difference of the values is displayed as
                           amount and percentage. In the rules, it is not possible to ignore the invoice
                           difference. In exceptional cases, the system can be configured so that only
                           an authorized employee may ignore the difference and create the invoice.
                       Technical info: numerical field, DB field: kauf.nettototal

                       VAT amount VAT amount of the POs. If you create the invoice, the field will
                       be pre-populated by the system. You can edit the amount. Depending on the
                       configuration, only a particular deviation is permitted. If the amount entered
                       deviates from the VAT amount from the POs, a message is displayed.If several
                       VAT rates are specified for a PO, the individual VAT rates are displayed. This
                       is important for countries where different tax rates are used. The fields are only
                       displayed if the multi-VAT module is active.
                       Technical info: numeric fields, DB fields: kauf.mwstbetrag1, kauf.mwstbetrag2,
                       kauf.mwstbetrag3, kauf.mwstbetrag4

                       Total amount gross Total gross amount of the POs. The system calculate
                       the gross amount from the total of Total net amount and VAT amount.
                       Technical info: numerical field, database field: kauf.gesbrutto

                       Total qty Total number of pieces of units from all purchase orders.
                       Technical info: display field

                       Total sqft Total area of the articles from the POs in square meters.
                       Technical info: display field

                       Total ser.mtr. Total length of the articles from the POs in linear meters.
                       Technical info: display field

                       Overview
                       In the Stock module, you have all functions that are required for successful
                       stock management, e.g. stock maintenance, stock bookings, inventories, as
                       well as the planning of incoming and outgoing articles. All prices are specified
                       as net prices in this module.
                       In the Stock part, you will find the following topics:
                       •   “Stock bookings” on page F-1700

                       •   “Information System” on page F-1765
                       •   “Print” on page F-1811
                       •   “System Administration” on page F-1813
                       •   “Minimum purchase price of the variant in the stock.” on page F-1814

                       Box warehouse in
                       Booking > Box warehouse in
                       On this dialog, you book the stock ins for complete boxes, e.g. grid box with
                       50 identical lites.
                       Via the selection of the right stock in the Stock field, you can select whether
                       you book the stock receipts into box warehouse or single lite box warehouse.

                           Box warehouse and single lite box warehouse
                           The difference in the stock bookings between box warehouse and single
                           lite warehouse is in the kind of box entry. In box warehouse, the lites with
                           the same characteristics (e.g.: price, yield) are booked by the box. In the
                           single lite box warehouse, the goods are booked as single lite (lites) with
                           associated information in the box in question.

                       You specify the stock type in the master data:
                        “Stockroom administration” on page F-1741
                       The Box in dialog includes the following tabs:
                       •   “Box warehouse in – pieces tab” on page F-1712

                       vidually.

                     • Box warehouse = stock for complete boxes. Boxes that are broken open
                        must be resolved and booked to another stock.
                     • Slot warehouse = stock for all articles with assigned designation of the slot.
                     • High bay warehouse = warehouse with storage spaces on high racks.
                     • Stack stock = stock for lites with uniform dimensions.
                     • Single lite box warehouse = stock for booking of individual lites in boxes.
                     • Rack warehouse = warehouse with storage spaces on racks.

                           Warehouse in inventory
                           If a warehouse is enabled for the inventory, a copy of the warehouse with
                           negative stock numbers is generated, the so-called inventory stock. The
                           stocks counted are entered in this inventory warehouse.
                           During the inventory, the stock ins and outs are still booked to the positive
                           stock number. This guarantees that during the inventory, stock in and out
                           bookings for this warehouse can be recorded.
                           After an inventory completion, the changed inventories are updated from
                           the inventory warehouse with the incoming and outgoing bookings that
                           were recorded during the inventory.

                       The dialogs for the inventory in the various warehouse types are structured
                       identically and are therefore described for the default warehouse. The descrip-
                       tion therefore applies for:
                       •   Box warehouse
                       •   Slot warehouse
                       •   Stack warehouse
                       •   Rack warehousek
                       You can execute the following keyboard commands:
                       •   With <F2>, you can switch the display between articles in pieces and arti-
                           cles in quantity unit.
                       •   With <Shift> + <F8>, you can complete the inventory.
                       •   With <Shift> + <F12>, you can discard the inventory.

                          Inventory without target inventory display
                          Via a system setting it is possible to activate a new inventory procedure.
                          This procedure should result in more precise counting since the target val-
                          ues are unknown. This way, they cannot simply be taken over.

                          With this configuration, the target inventory is not displayed and the actual
                          inventory to be entered is empty when you open the inventory. Now, the in-
                          ventory counted must be entered for each record. Even if there is no inven-
                          tory, a 0 must be stored. Only when all numbers are filled with values can
                          the inventory be completed.

                     Booking status – inventory

                     Fig. F-57     Booking status – inventory


                     On this dialog, you can display the booking information about the stocks that
                     contain unbooked or flawed booking records or stocks that are in inventory at
                     the moment. On the Booking status – Correction dialog, you can correct the
                     data for the booking status.

                         Warehouse in inventory
                         If a warehouse is enabled for inventory, a copy of the stock with negative
                         stock numbers is generated, the so-called inventory stock. Inventory is tak-
                         en and entered in this inventory stock.
                         During the inventory, the stock ins and outs are still booked to the positive
                         stock number. This guarantees that during the inventory, stock in and out
                         bookings for this stock can be recorded.
                         After an inventory completion, the changed stocks are updated from the in-
                         ventory stock with the incoming and outgoing bookings that were recorded
                         during the inventory.

                     You can execute the following keyboard command:
                     •   With <F5>, you can call up the Booking Status – Correction dialog.

                     Body

                         Stock number of the stock that is enabled for inventory.
                     •   Description:
                         Description of the stock in inventory.
                     •   Date:
                         Date on which the stock was prepared for inventory.
                     •   Employee:
                         Employee number of the employee who prepared the stock for inventory.

                       Stock backup
                       System > Stock backup




                       Fig. F-70    Stock backup


                       This dialog displays information about the last data backup. If you would like
                       to back up the stock data, you need an appropriate system configuration. The
                       back-up can only be done by an employee authorized to do this. In the config-
                       uration you can specify on which day the automated backup of the stock ta-
                       bles: wlfach, wlgest, wlx, wlxifo, wlxv will be done.

                          Backup day
                          The default value in the configuration is the 16th of the month. You can also
                          specify the backup for other days: valid settings are between 1 and 31,
                          whereby 31 is always the last day of the month and is adjusted automati-
                          cally to the month (28(29), 30 or 31).

                          At the time of the backup, no stock inventories and no flawed bookings may
                          be open; otherwise, the backup cannot be done. If successful or in case of
                          error, the responsible employee can be informed about the result via e-
                          mail. Please contact a A+W employee for the correct system setting for this
                          function.

                       Date Date of the last backup.
                       Technical info: display field, DB field: wlx_m.savedate

                       Time Time of the last backup.
                       Technical info: display field, DB field: wlx_m.savetime

G-1858                                                                        A+W Enterprise Dispatch Control
Tutorial                                                                                     Introduction




                       Introduction
                       The tutorial for the Dispatch Control introduces you to A+W Enterprise logis-
                       tics. The tutorial builds on the knowledge of glass production, workflow, and
                       knowledge of other A+W Enterprise modules.

                           The functions depend on the released modules
                           Please note that the individual functions are available only if the corre-
                           sponding modules and interfaces have been released.

                           If you detect functions in this description that are not available in your ver-
                           sion, please contact A+W Software GmbH.

                           Furthermore, the program steps only make sense in a particular sequence.
                           For example, goods can only be loaded on trucks whose production is
                           complete. Thus, the functions are also accessible from the logistics se-
                           quence.

                       Subject areas
                       This tutorial offers the following subject areas:
                       •   “Menu Overview” on page G-1860
                       •   “General Operating Steps” on page G-1861
                       •   “Dispatch Explorer” on page G-1866
                       •   “Service Function” on page G-1890

                       Prerequisite knowledge
                       The tutorial is aimed at users who work at A+W Enterprise in the logistics area
                       and who are familiar with all everyday tasks there.




A+W Enterprise Dispatch Control                                                                  G-1859

                ther from A+W Enterprise or select the module directly when the connection is

G-1860                                                     A+W Enterprise Dispatch Control
Tutorial                                                                      General Operating Steps




                       General Operating Steps
                       Dispatch Control in A+W Enterprise displays the data on several levels:
                       •   For a delivery date
                       •   For a tour
                       •   For an order
                       •   For particular items.
                       To reach the desired level, use <F5> or click the [Details] button. Jump back
                       to the original level with <End>.
                       If you deliver goods by the rack, you will also have a rack view.
                       Generally, there is the following distinction:
                       •   The route is a specified driving route that is driven on particular days, e.g.
                           route 300 from Frankfurt to Munich is driven on Mondays and Thursdays.
                       •   The tour is the distance to be driven on a particular delivery date, e.g., the
                           tour on route 300 delivers the customer orders on Thursday April 28.

Tutorial                                                                      General Operating Steps




                       Navigation in dispatch
                       Use <F2> to change between the tab and the current level within a data level.
                       Several tabs are available on the following levels:
                       •   Tour level
                       •   Order level
                       •   Item level
                       Not all tabs are available in every customer configuration. The rack and opti-
                       mization tabs are displayed dynamically with the appropriate configuration.
                       Use <F5> to change from an upper data level to a lower one. Use <END> to
                       change back to the upper level. Skipping a data level is not possible.
                       Navigation is explained in the following workflow:


                        Here's how to access the Items view:
                       1 Start the Dispatch Control module.
                       2 Enter the delivery date. The program checks whether there are tours on
                         this date with orders to be delivered.
                         If you are working with the Dispatch Explorer, you can enter a time period
                         from-to for the delivery dates you are searching for in the dialog header.
                            Tutorial, “Dispatch Explorer” on page G-1866
                       3 Use the [Details] button to change to the tour level.
                       4 Select a tour and press the [Orders] button to change to the order level.
                       5 From the order level, you can use the [Tours] or [Explorer] button to return
                         to the original level. Or ... .
                       6 Select an order and press the [Items] button to change to the item level.
                       7 You can change the views at will.
                       8 If you want to reach a particular order directly, follow the instructions in the
                         next section:
                            Tutorial, “Jump to...” on page G-1864

                          Searching for an order/a PO
                          In A+W Enterprise you can search for your deliveries (orders and goods re-
                          ceived/dispatched).
                          In selos (<F9>) on the document fields such as order, PO, you can use the ad-
                          vanced search for the criteria you would like. The advanced search is not

                       Move a tour
                       The prerequisite for moving a complete tour assumes that the new tour is
                       stored in the master data and the driving days are considered for the new date.

                       Objectives

                       • Move tour to another delivery date.
                       • Move tour to another route.


                       Benefits

                       • Moving in dispatch control is an important part of the logistical work. Each delivery
                         must be easy to find in the system and it must be possible to call up all important
                         delivery data at any time.
                       • When moving an entire tour, it can be locked completely.
                       • Many functions and the selection fields can be configured so that the actions can
                         be executed with just a few movements; please contact the responsible A+W
                         employee.


                        Here's how to move a tour
                       1 TourInfo tab: Mark tour > [Move].
                          Move (dispatch) dialog opens.
                       2 Select reason for the move with <Spacebar> and enter a note if necessary.
                       3 On tour day field: Enter delivery date.
                          If the new date is not a valid route date, then the tour cannot be moved.
                          If a tour plan is created: Click the On tour day field <F9> and select tour.
                       4 Trigger move with [Start].
                          The tour is moved completely to the new delivery date. It is no longer
                          displayed for the original date on the TourInfo tab.
                       5 Check move: Start tour search with new delivery date.
                       6 Alternative: Move tour for the same date to another route:
                       7 On tour day field: Check delivery date.
                       8 Route field: Enter new route.
                          If the delivery date is not a route day, the tour cannot be moved.
                       9 Trigger move with [Start].
                          The tour is moved completely to the new route.
                          If the delivery date was kept, the tour is displayed with the new route
                          number.

         Rack reports from A+W Production
         If due to the report from A+W Production a PO for the ordered processings is
         generated, then in Dispatch, 2 sentences are generated for this PO (exception
         of direct delivery). At the same time, additional data for each PO is written to
         a new DB table 'lapoolstrukt' so that the lites from the level of the processing
         ordered are noted. These will be reported later, after the production has been
         packed temporarily in order to be able to send the pre-products to the suppli-
         ers.
         In the table, item and tuple from the order as well as item and tuple of the PO
         aer noted.
         Due to the temporarily packed message of the PO items, the quantities are re-
         ported available.
         This data is booked analogously to the SA side in the new table 'kpossumek'.
         Rack messages from PDC can now also be generated for intermediate prod-
         ucts. The evaluation of these bookings has now also been activated for SA
         documents. The assignment of the lites is done with additional information
         about the associated element (tuple) of the lite in the BOM of the PO item. If
         the data is present in dispatch (sufficient quantities) for the rack reports, then
         the racks will also be assigned immediately and permanently to a tour and the
         associated PU delivery records are reported packed in dispatch.
         All functionalities for the rack that are listed via the "Rack" submenu in dispatch
         are also active for PU documents (goods out mode).



G-1882                                                   A+W Enterprise Dispatch Control
Tutorial                                                                                         Racks




                       Exception
                       For the case that a LAMI is ordered externally, several individual lites that are
                       reported on racks belong to an order item. We call a rack symmetrically loaded
                       if a complete order item can be formed from the lites on it. Thus, the quantities
                       reported by PDC are only reported packed and assigned if the rack is loaded
                       symmetrically. If no complete order items could be formed without leftovers
                       from the glass quantities reported, the quantities are only assigned to the rack
                       and must then be distributed appropriately manually so that the order items
                       can be reported completely packed and a rack can be booked permanently to
                       the tour.


                       Rack reports from A+W Production
                       When packing or dispatching a rack, there is a report with the rack assignment
                       to the ERP system. Here, normally all lites on the rack are reported. Using the
                       booked processing of the lites on the rack, it can now be determined whether
                       a rack report for the extended workbench should be made. With an extant
                       switch, only lites are reported whose processing packing or dispatch has al-
                       ready been booked. This prevents that
                       a rack is reported packed or dispatched if there are only lites on the rack
                       whose processing is booked temporarily packed or temporarily dispatched for
                       the extended workbench.
                       With another switch, it is possible to distinguish during packing of a rack
                       whether the lites on the back have booked pack processing or intermediate
                       pack for the extended workbench. If the processing pack is booked, the report
                       for packing with the packed lites is made. If no processing pack is booked but
                       the processing intermediate pack, then there is now a new rack report with the
                       temporarily packed lites.

Tutorial                                                 Incorporation of the A+W Logistics Optimizer




                       Incorporation of the A+W Lo-
                       gistics Optimizer
                       Triggering actions
                       The following changes were implemented:
                       If a tour is optimized, the rack assignments for this delivery day and route are
                       moved to the optimization tour.
                       If a tour is optimized, this is now entered in the move log.
                       If a tour is optimized, now in addition to the telephone number, e-mail, contact
                       person, and the revenue of the items transferred are transferred to the route
                       optimization.
                       During reporting of an optimized route, now the delivery day and the driving
                       duration in days are reported to dispatch (if tour is on the road for more than
                       one day).
                       If a tour is deleted from route optimization, the previous route assignment is
                       now restored in dispatch.
                       A tour already optimized can now no longer be transferred to the route optimi-
                       zation. The tour must previously be deleted from the route optimization.
                       Moving in dispatch is no longer allowed for optimized tours and nothing can be
                       moved manually to an optimized tour.

G-1894                                                                   A+W Enterprise Dispatch Control
Software Reference                                                                            Overview




                       Overview
                       All Dispatch Control views, dialogs, and functions are accessible via the Logis-
                       tics module. You can also start the module directly from FixWin. In the default
                       configuration, you start directly with the Dispatch Explorer:
                        “Dispatch Explorer” on page G-1901
                       With Dispatch Control, you find, plan, process, and send your delivery orders
                       on time. Dispatch Control is the control center for dispatch and provides quick
                       and easy access to all delivery orders. For example, you create a list of all de-
                       livery dates for a period or jump directly into the delivery order you're looking
                       for. For the overview of the dispatch documents, each delivery order is divided
                       into the following four levels:
                       •   Delivery dates
                       •   Tours and routes
                       •   Orders
                       •   Items
                       The first level shows the delivery dates. A delivery date includes the corre-
                       sponding routes or tours.
                       The second level shows the routes and tours. A tour includes the correspond-
                       ing orders and can consist of one or more routes. A tour represents at least
                       one route on a certain delivery date. The route is a defined route to be traveled.
                       Routes can be assigned to certain weekdays or certain times. The tour level
                       offers an overview of existing dispatch documents.
                       The orders are shown on the third level. An order consists of the appropriate
                       items and shipping address. The order level offers an overview of existing dis-
                       patch documents.
                       Items are shown on the fourth level. An item includes the appropriate units.
                       Open tours, orders or items are locked for processing by other employees.
                       They are then only opened with read rights.

            Technical info in dispatch
            Some important data is stored in the database table lapool. This data ex-
            ists per order or PO item, route and delivery date. Various displays on the
            dialogs are formed dynamically or calculated at program runtime. There-
            fore, the details about the technical information are generally not possible
            1:1. In such cases, the Technical Info entry is omitted in this document.
            The field contents that are determined program-internally (via SQL state-
            ment) are not listed in this document. If necessary, please consult the da-
            tabase documentation.
